newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoil dips as futures knock modest prem gains.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoil dips as futures knock modest prem gains.

text.p: NWE gas oil was steady to a touch weaker on Tuesday as marginally firmer premiums for several grades failed to offset a slide in IPE futures.
April IPE gas oil last traded at $165.50, down $1.25 having spent much of the day flat or 25 to 50 cents down.

"It is very slow, partly because people got their requirements out of the way last week (before the Easter holiday weekend)," said one trader. Heating oil barge premiums were about 50 cents firmer with trades done at April IPE flat fob ARA and at April IPE +50 cents for first half April.
Russian cargo premiums were also about 50 cents stronger, with offers pegged around April IPE +$2 cif NWE although nearly all prompt material has been done.
The arb to Asia is workable into May, say traders, but there remained growing concern that this eastwards trade may collapse.
FOD was still scarce in NWE and buying interest was modest. A late trade last week indicated levels were now around April IPE +$2-4 cif NWE.
DIN lost ground after last week's very strong April +$7.50 cif. "The buyer who was supporting that market is no longer backing it," commented one trader.
